OP

White collar recession comes before regular recession 100% of the time. We've been in a white collar recession since 2020.

Always was, its depression for over a year now.

61857508
>>61857490
GDP is growing, recession is fake.

Nothing ever happens.

Stop putting your vibes and feelings into your job search, learn to get better skills and be more marketable to employers.

McDonalds is always hiring

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61857750
>>61857490
>The US is in recession
You have no idea how bad things are about to get in the US. Trump and his idiot advisors have doomed the country.

61857763
>>61857508
>McDonalds is always hiring
Except I literally could not get hired by McDonalds, with a 4.0 GPA in engineering.
Got a government job on preferential minority hiring... but you cannot be serious that the economy is fine.

61857774
>>61857763

Remove your degree from your resume dumbass

61857779
>>61857750
What exactly have they done that doomed the country in a way it wasn't doomed by decisions made before then?

61857802
Tariffs fucked everyone

61857805
>>61857779
Disrupted the international order from which the US greatly benefitted. Trust is not easy to get back. When other countries realize the US is actually a mad dog, they begin to sell the dollar and invest less in the country. Everything else pales in relation to this. Blowing up the relationship with Canada and Mexico was asinine.

61857808
>>61857779
unironically the us was approaching economic recovery in early 2025

61857812
>>61857774
>intentionally misrepresenting the point to fit your agenda

61857815
I've been cumming a lot lately. 300% as much. I'm 3x on cum this week.

61857824
>>61857805
>International order
Largely everything needed can be gotten in the US's backyard, such as Venezuelan oil, and be taken with minimal effort. Sure, it is tough to get everything optimal and a transition, but there was no other way

61857825
>>61857508
lmao kill all boomers

>>61857805
Canada isn't relevant and never will be relevant, mexico is totally dependent on the US and a parasite narco state. Being a pussy to appease useless europoors is not useful to a country like the USA that can invest in itself and have everything it needs. The only reason we haven't invaded greenland is hoping europeans stop with your constant arrogant bullshit and see the error of your faggoty ways.

61857830
>>61857808
No it wasn't. And continuing to lie on 4chan won't change that.

61857840
>>61857830
>it just wasn't
inflation was going down, employment was going up, consumer optimism was increasing. by every metric the economy was fragile but recovering. this administration destroyed that

61857846
>>61857824
>there was no other way
Yeah except the way everything has been done for a century. You think the US had to go full autarky because… why exactly?
>>61857825
Canada is the largest consumer of US goods, followed by Mexico.

I mean what, do you guys think life will improve when international trade suffers? You don’t really believe that flippant and transient tariffs that last a few weeks and are leveraged as bargaining chips are going to bring back manufacturing, right?

61857862
The best part:
>Almost all the growth is from Healthcare and Social Assistance
We are literally living in an economy built for boomers. Only jobs available are changing boomer diapers. GRIM GRIM GIM.
This timeline sucks!

61857876
>>61857846

Yes, they really do. Burgerfats are that retarded.

61857891

>>61857808
this look at hard data not just number go up in a handful of ai stocks that dragged the entire index up
without ai spend 2022-23 and 24 were a recession but the stock numbers were moved up

61858020

This is all part of a plan. The chinese have been causing all bubbles since the GFC because they have nothing to spend FIAT money on so trump has to end the trade deficit to stabilize things and that means massively devaluing the US dollar.

61858023
>>61857508

61858131

For "crypto", obviously Bitcoin (BTC, not any of the scams that claim to be satoshi's vision or "cash" or other dogshit).

For stonks, I'd pick an S&P500 tracking ETF. If you absolutely insist on a single corporation, I'd wait for the SpaceX IPO. I currently have a little worry about the Democraps trying to destroy Elon, but right now SpaceX is essential, there is no other company that can do what they do. Remember when Biden left astronauts stranded on the ISS for eight months because he refused to let Elon send up a special mission to bring them back? Remember when Artemis finally launched its test flight seven years late?

Despite BO posturing, BONG only has the capacity of FH but with a wider fairing, while BONS is a fucking amusement park ride for the super-rich; literally the only reason BONG might ever get chosen by private industry is anti-Musk hatred (the feds will subsidize the fuck out of BO just to keep "second source" capability). ULA is having repeated trouble with Vulcan booster failures and only exists due to direct subsidies; it's not even remotely cost-competitive with SpaceX, and will probably be dropped as "second source" if BO ever gets certified.

As for foreign competition, no one trusts China with their satellites because of Chinese espionage, the EU's ArianeSpace is just France trying to pretend to be relevant, and LOL Russia ROFL, see vidrelated.

Starship will make SpaceX the most efficient launch operator ever, with costs to orbit dropping by literally over an order of magnitude compared to any competitor. They're going to be huge.

OP

Anons, i want to divest from the US. I see a lot of companies and people doing it. I don't want to be the last one left. I don't want to invest in crypto since a lot of countries are starting to pass regulations for it. I don't want to invest in China. Where should i put my money in? Any ideas?

>>61856272

61856290
Invest in Japanese industry. Particularly companies that produce equipment for the nuclear energy sector

>>61856281
>invest in europe
That's very broad. Got any specific leads? People have been trying to tell me to invest in defence stocks but everyone seems to be trying to bid for those right now and i am not a big enough player.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61856302
>>61856290
Good advise. Japan is going to try and make their own nukes so they will invest more into that sector. So i guess i'll do a split between Europe and Japan. Now i just need to find the right stocks.

61856305
>>61856272
>https://www.justetf.com/en/etf-profile.html?isin=IE0006WW1TQ4
Take this as base and add some individual EM countries that you want. Mexico, South East Asia, Turkey, Argentina...your choice

61856312
>>61856297
defence isn't a bad bet. if you're looking for single companies you should look for defence adjacent industrial businesses that are now adapting their production to defence, of which there are plenty. there is also a european defence ETF by wisdromtree, but you're buying mostly rheinmetall and saab with that one.
honestly i think that you will already outperform the S&P500 with an MSCI Europe ETF for the next couple of years, especially if the USD falls further against the EUR, so i would just go with that.

61856315

61856339
>>61856272

That way you get to invest in markets at a discount and stack the numbers in your favor.

Some good options: Japan, Australia, Mexico, Canada

Apart from price movement BTC is a total failure.

Open thread • Replies: 16 • Updated: 2026-02-15 21:18 UTC

OP

Early replies (first 3)

I remember I wanted it to go up but I had 8 work from home jobs back then and the government kept sending me checks

61854716

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61854885
>>61854677
>what does a bit coin do again?
It makes me richer every 4 years. That's all it needs to do.

61854899
Dull.

Physical goods require active force simply to maintain ownership, trust-based assets require trusted third parties (TTPs) to operate them. Storing abstract economic value in either enables negative sum actors (NSAs) to parasite as negative sum actors can specialize exclusively in force, taking physical goods by force and either coercing TTPs, or using force to BECOME the TTP (the origin of State). Positive sum actors had to either reduce their own production to make time for murdering/imprisoning/exiling NSAs, pay extortion to them, or employ positive sum actors specializing in force (police/military), however, as abstract economic value was seizable, there was a constant selection pressure for these “immune cells” to turn malignant.

Hence the cyclic nature of empire/nation growth and decay, positive sum actors build, negative sum actors corrupt and destroy, NSAs are excised & PSAs rebuild from the ashes. As can be seen, PSAs have been at a HUGE disadvantage to NSAs through history, the best “solution” we had come up with pre-BTC was Plato’s Benevolent Philosopher King, a perfectly trustworthy trusted third party, do you have any Benevolent Philosopher Kings lying around? Not a real solution.

But by placing abstract economic value beyond the veil of voluntarity, positive sum actors can reverse the advantage. Satoshi has “fixed the glitch”, NSAs will no longer be able to parasite “so it'll just work itself out naturally”. No force, no confrontation, necessary.

Bitcoin obsolesces coercion, achieving Voluntarism not via an impossible to implement memeshit “non-aggression principle”, but by removing the systemic profitability of force.

OP

Tell me about your side hustles. Do any of you guys do trading cards, YouTube videos, DoorDash, furniture flipping, Etsy shops, Amazon FBA, dog walking, or lawn care? I sell whittles online and my girlfriend flips thrift store clothes on Poshmark. We're pulling in about $800 to $1200 extra per month combined but it's super inconsistent. What side hustles have you tried that either worked out great or were a complete waste of time? Would love to hear what's been profitable for you and what you'd straight up avoid.

>>61858029
I've been thinking about brewing cheap sugar whine and selling it to alcoholics, but I'm afraid it might be a bit illegal and difficult to pull off

61858114
>>61858029
I used to tutor physics and math online (Masters in Mech Engineering). During Covid, it was busy and steady. Now, not so much. I used to charge $40/hour and averaged like 15 hours a week. Looking for a new hustle, even though I make $140k/year now, I want extra cash to throw in the markets

61858207
Sometimes I find good vintage audio equipment in thrift stores for dirt cheap and can flip it.
